tags.label: Tags
tags.description: This is a list of keywords and terms associated with this object type.  An instance of _AdaptiveTag_ can be used to define and document the purpose of a tag.  Adaptive Framework reserves the definition of all tags that begin with "_Adaptive".
tags.brief: List of keywords associated with this object type

runtime.label: Runtime
runtime.description: This is only valid for runtime object types.  These are objects that are accessed with adaptorId afw.  See afw_runtime.h for more information.
runtime.brief: Runtime information, available to runtime objects

referenceURI.label: Reference URI
referenceURI.description: URI of more reference information about this object.
referenceURI.brief: URI of more reference information about this object

propertyTypes.label: Property Types
propertyTypes.description: An object whose properties contain the _AdaptiveValueMeta_ for properties with corresponding name in instances of this _AdaptiveObjectType_.
propertyTypes.brief: Describes the properties for this object type

otherProperties.label: Other Properties
otherProperties.description: If specified, this is the property type for properties that are not explicitly specified.  If otherProperties is not specified, only explicitly specified properties are allowed.
otherProperties.brief: Property Type for properties not explicitly specified

originURI.label: Origin URI
originURI.description: The origin URI of this object type.  Descendant object types should be used for any deviations.  This URI may be different from the URI within this instance of Adaptive Framework.
originURI.brief: The origin URI of this object type

objectType.label: Object Type
objectType.description: The object id of the object type.
objectType.brief: Object id of the object type

objectIdPropertyName.label: Object Id Property Name
objectIdPropertyName.description: The name of the property in an instance that is used as the "objectId" property in the meta for instances of this object type.  If not specified, the internal adaptor objectId for an object is used.
objectIdPropertyName.brief: The name of the property that is used as the "objectId" meta property

label.label: Label
label.description: Label used to identify this instance.
label.brief: Label used to identify this instance

descriptionPropertyName.label: Description Property Name
descriptionPropertyName.description: The name of the property in an instance that is used as the "description" property in the meta for instances of this object type.  If not specified, no description will be available.
descriptionPropertyName.brief: The name of the property that is used as the "description" meta property

description.label: Description
description.description: The description of the object type.

collectionURIs.label: Collection URIs
collectionURIs.description: This is the URIs of the collections this object type is a part of and preferably a URIs that can be used to locate an object with objects type _AdaptiveCollection_ that describes the collections.  If a collection is used outside of the local instance, it should be a full URI.  The URI can also be a local path of the collection object or just the collection's objectId if it resides in the in the same adaptor.
collectionURIs.brief: The URIs of the collections this object type is a part of

allowEntity.label: Allow Entity
allowEntity.description: Instances of this object type can exist as an entity object, not just an embedded object.
allowEntity.brief: Instances of this type can exist as entities

allowDelete.label: Allow Delete
allowDelete.description: If false, objects of this type can NEVER be deleted via an adaptor.  If true, objects of this type can be deleted via an adaptor as long as allowed by authorization policy and the adaptor.
allowDelete.brief: Objects of this type can be deleted

allowChange.label: Allow Change
allowChange.description: If false, objects of this type can NEVER be changed via an adaptor.  If true, objects of this type can be changed via an adaptor as long as allowed by authorization policy and the adaptor.
allowChange.brief: Objects of this type can be changed

allowAdd.label: Allow Add
allowAdd.description: If false, objects of this type can NEVER be added via an adaptor.  If true, objects of this type can be added via an adaptor as long as allowed by authorization policy and the adaptor.
allowAdd.brief: Objects of this type can be created

result.description: The adaptive object type of all adaptive object type objects.

sourceLocation.label: Source Location
sourceLocation.description: This is a contextual string added when this configuration object is processed.
sourceLocation.brief: Contextual string added when this configuration object is processed

title.label: Title
title.description: The title of the application.  This is used as the title of the Adaptive Framework Web App and is available for use in other places as appropriate.

qualifiedVariables.label: Qualified Variables
qualifiedVariables.description:
The name of each property in this object corresponds to a qualifier that is available in processing associated with this application.  The qualifier can not be an empty string.  The properties of these "qualifier objects" are hybrid values that are accessible as qualified variables.  These variables are evaluated once per scope as they are accessed.

Some qualifiers are restricted.

layoutsAdaptorId.label: Layouts Adaptor
layoutsAdaptorId.description: This is the adaptorId that locates Adaptive Layout Component objects.
layoutsAdaptorId.brief: The default adaptorId to select for layout component objects

extensions.label: Extensions
extensions.description: This is a list of extensionId of extensions to load at startup.  Each extensionId must be the objectId of an object in /afw/_AdaptiveManifest_/.
extensions.brief: List of extensions to load at startup

defaultModelAdaptorId.label: Default Model Adaptor
defaultModelAdaptorId.description: When presented with multiple model adaptors, this is the default adaptorId to use.  This will be the default selected adaptor chosen by user interface components.
defaultModelAdaptorId.brief: The default adaptorId to select for model storage

defaultFlags.label: Default Flags
defaultFlags.description: This is a list of the flagId of default flags that will be set when a scope (request) is created.  Flags in this list that are not yet registered will be set as a default when/if they are registered.  Each registered flagId is the objectId of an object in /afw/_AdaptiveFlag_/.
defaultFlags.brief: List of default flags to be set when a scope (request) is created.

defaultAdaptorId.label: Default Adaptor
defaultAdaptorId.description: This is the adaptorId chosen by default for user interface select components.
defaultAdaptorId.brief: This is the adaptorId chosen by default for user interface select components

confAdaptorId.label: Conf Adaptor
confAdaptorId.description:
This is the optional adaptorId of the running adaptor that contains configuration related objects.  This property can only be specified in the type=application entry of the conf file.

The runtime /afw/_AdaptiveApplication_/current object will consist of properties from the type=application entry of the conf file plus unique properties from the optional /<confAdaptorId>/_AdaptiveConf_application/<applicationId> object.

All services defined by _AdaptiveServiceConf_ objects in <confAdaptorId> with startup "permanent" or "immediate" will be started when the type=application conf entry is processed.
confAdaptorId.brief: Optional adaptorId of the running adaptor that contains configuration related objects

authorizationControl.label: Authorization
authorizationControl.description: This defines how authorization checking occurs in this application.
authorizationControl.brief: This defines how authorization checking occurs in this application

applicationId.label: Application
applicationId.description: This is id of the application.  The default applicationId is "application".  This property can only be specified in the type=application entry of the conf file.
applicationId.brief: This is the id of the application

result.description:
Adaptive Framework configuration component for type=application.  There is only one application conf entry per Adaptive Framework instance.

Use path /afw/_AdaptiveConf_application/current to access this entry at run time.
Each property is a hybrid value.

startup.label: Startup
startup.description: Service startup condition specifies how the service should be started.  Choose 'manual', if you intend to start the service by hand.  Choose 'immediate' if the service should be started as soon as it as loaded.  Services defined in the main configuration file are 'permanent', which are started immediately and cannot be stopped.

serviceId.label: Service Id
serviceId.description: Service id.  This is the type and type specific id property separated with a '-'.  For example, for conf type=adaptor, adaptorId=x, the serviceId must be "adaptor-x".

conf.label: Conf
conf.description: Configuration object.  The object must have type and id property where type is a supported value.
